intro: Hypochaeris rosengurttii, commonly known as the Rosengurt's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Hypochaeris rosengurttii is often found in disturbed habitats and can sometimes be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
